title: Sri Lanka President blocks deputy speaker’s resignation amid losing support
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT -President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has refused to accept the resignation of Deputy Speaker Ranjith Siyambalapitiya and requested him to continue in the post, a statement by the President’s media said.

The move comes as 42 legislators from President’s ruling Sri Lanka Podujana Peremuna (SLPP) withdrew their support amid an increasingly intensifying public protest demanding Rajapaksa and his government to step down after their economic mismanagement.
President’s ruling SLPP is now facing an imminent threat of losing parliamentary majority in the 225-member legislature.
Siyambalapitiya’s Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), a partner of the ruling SLPP coalition has already left the government and decided to work independently in the parliament.
Siyambalapitiya in his resignation letter said he took the decision  aligning with the party’s decision.
The President’s Media Unit (PMD) said Rajapaksa declined the resignation saying parliamentary democracy must be safely carried forward.

After a discussion held with the SLFP members at the President Secretariat, Siyambalapitiya has agreed to continue to serve as the Deputy Speaker with the consent of the Parliamentary Group representing the SLFP.
Tuesday’s mass defection from SLPP came amid a worsening economic crisis precipitated a political crisis in the island nation (Colombo/ April 06/2022)
